reference.shortdesc: The part element references a topic or a map that acts as a part within a book.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: Use part to divide a document's chapters into logical groupings. For example, in a document that contains both guide and reference information, you can define two parts, one containing the guide information and the other containing the reference information.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The part element is specialized from topicref. It is defined in the bookmap module.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how part elements are used to group chapters in order to divide a book into two major sections for task and reference material:<bookmap> <title>Using and maintaining Product Zed</title> <!-- ... metadata and front matter ... -> <part href="taskguide.dita"> <chapter href="intro.dita"> <topicref href="caring.dita"/> <topicref href="feeding.dita"/> </chapter> <chapter href="setup.dita"> <topicref href="prereq.dita"/> <topicref href="download.dita"/> </chapter> </part> <part href="reference.dita"> <chapter href="commands.dita"> <topicref href="care.dita"/> <topicref href="feed.dita"/> </chapter> <chapter href="apis.dita"> <topicref href="acare.dita"/> <topicref href="afeed.dita"/> </chapter> </part> </bookmap>
